Industrial Light & Magic did the opening scene in which San Francisco is wiped out on Judgement Day, inspired by the Los Angeles nuclear destruction in ''Terminator 2'', and the Terminator vision.<ref name=fxguide/> For the IMAX 3D release, the film was remastered with [[IMAX DMR]] technology to create 3D effects and a high-resolution film print.<ref>{{cite news|title=Terminator Genisys to be Released in IMAX Globally Starting July 1|url=http://www.comingsoon.net/movies/news/411443-terminator-genisys-to-be-released-in-imax-globally-starting-july-1|date=Feb 19, 2015|publisher=[[ComingSoon.net]]|accessdate=July 2, 2015}}</ref>
==Music== {{Infobox album | name = Terminator Genisys: Music from the Motion Picture | type = Film | longtype = ([[digital audio]]) | artist = Lorne Balfe (except bonus track) | cover = | alt = | released = June 24, 2015 | recorded = | venue = | studio = | genre = Soundtrack | length = 75:03 | label = Skydance | producer = [[Hans Zimmer]] (executive) | chronology = ''[[Terminator (franchise)|Terminator]]'' soundtrack | prev_title = [[Terminator Salvation (soundtrack)|Terminator Salvation]] | prev_year = 2009 | next_title = | next_year = }}
[[Lorne Balfe]] composed the film's score.<ref>{{cite web|title=Terminator Genisys (Music from the Motion Picture)|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/terminator-genisys-music-from/id1012086990|publisher=iTunes Store}}</ref> Balfe aimed to create a soundtrack which stood in its own, since ''Terminator Genisys'' is "not a prequel and not a sequel", incorporating [[Brad Fiedel]]'s iconic theme in ''The Terminator'': "have a nod to the past but also bring it into the future."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.musictimes.com/articles/41966/20150701/exclusive-interview-terminator-genisys-composer-lorne-balfe-talks-2015-movie.htm|title=EXCLUSIVE INTERVIEW: 'Terminator Genisys' Composer Lorne Balfe Talks 2015 Movie Score & More!|author=Niles, Jon|date=July 1, 2015|publisher=Music Times|accessdate=September 9, 2015}}</ref> Chinese [[pop singer]] [[Jane Zhang]] and [[Hip hop music|hip hop]] artist [[Big Sean]] contributed "Fighting Shadows", released by [[Def Jam Recordings]] on June 30, 2015, as a soundtrack bonus track.<ref>{{cite web|title=Fighting Shadows (From "Terminator Genisys") [feat. Big Sean] – Single|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/fighting-shadows-from-terminator/id1012121257|publisher=iTunes Store}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=New Music: Jane Zhang feat. Big Sean – ‘Fighting Shadows’|url=http://www.rap-up.com/2015/06/30/new-music-jane-zhang-big-sean-fighting-shadows/|website=Rap-Up.com|publisher=Rap-Up}}</ref> The track is Zhang's first English-language recording and Big Sean's musical feature-film debut.<ref>{{cite web|title=Jane Zhang and Big Sean Record Original Song for ‘Terminator Genisys’|url=http://www.eurweb.com/2015/06/jane-zhang-and-big-sean-record-original-song-for-terminator-genisys|website=EURweb|publisher=EURweb|quote=The partnership represents the first time that Zhang has recorded a song for an English-language film and marks Big Sean’s musical debut for a feature film.|accessdate=June 17, 2015}}</ref> A music video of the single, produced and directed by Robby Starbuck, included footage from the film.<ref>{{cite web|title=Fighting Shadows Music Video|url=http://www.pirateartdepartment.com/#!terminator%20sample%201B.jpg/zoom/c1jnk/c10gt}}</ref> [[The Ramones]]' "[[I Wanna Be Sedated]]", [[OneRepublic]]'s "[[Love Runs Out]]" and [[Inner Circle (band)|Inner Circle's]] "[[Bad Boys (Inner Circle song)|Bad Boys]]" are heard in the film but not included in the soundtrack.
===Soundtrack=== {{Track listing | collapsed = yes | headline = ''Terminator Genisys: Music from the Motion Picture'' | all_writing = | all_lyrics = | all_music = Lorne Balfe, except the bonus track | total_length = 75:03 | title1 = Fate and Hope | length1 = 3:57 | title2 = Better Days | length2 = 3:05 | title3 = Work Camp | length3 = 3:37 | title4 = Bus Ride | length4 = 2:03 | title5 = Sarah & Kyle | length5 = 4:36 | title6 = Alley Confrontation | length6 = 2:33 | title7 = Sarah Kicks Ass | length7 = 1:53 | title8 = Cyberdyne | length8 = 3:41 | title9 = Still After Us | length9 = 2:52 | title10 = Come With Me | length10 = 3:42 | title11 = John Connor | length11 = 2:56 | title12 = It’s Really Me | length12 = 2:36 | title13 = Alcove | length13 = 2:17 | title14 = I Am More | length14 = 2:40 | title15 = If You Love Me You Die | length15 = 5:52 | title16 = Judgment Day | length16 = 2:56 | title17 = Family | length17 = 3:14 | title18 = Fight | length18 = 3:01 | title19 = Sacrifice | length19 = 4:21 | title20 = Guardianship | length20 = 3:26 | title21 = What If I Can't? | length21 = 4:23 | title22 = Terminated | note22 = based on "The Terminator Theme" from the film ''[[The Terminator]]'' composed by [[Brad Fiedel]] | length22 = 2:00 | title23 = Fighting Shadows | note23 = bonus-track single written by King Logan, Eric Dawkins, Sean Anderson and Jane Zhang | length23 = 3:11 }}
==Release== ''Terminator Genisys'' saw its European premiere in [[Berlin]], on June 21, 2015,<ref>[https://www.reuters.com/article/us-film-terminator-genisys-idUKKBN0P215H20150622 He's back: Schwarzenegger reprises role in 'Terminator Genisys']</ref> and had its North American premiere at the [[Dolby Theatre]] in Hollywood one week later, on June 28.<ref>[https://variety.com/2015/scene/vpage/arnold-schwarzenegger-terminator-genisys-premiere-1201530500/ Arnold Schwarzenegger’s Back in Hollywood With ‘Terminator Genisys’ Premiere], ''Variety''</ref> The film was first released in ten markets on June 25; the following week, it was released in 35 countries (including the United States)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2015/06/international-box-office-terminator-genisys-ted-2-jurassic-world-minions-inside-out-1201460765/|title=‘Terminator: Genisys’ Bows To $8.3M; ‘Jurassic World’ Adds $82.5M In International BO – Deadline|first1=Nancy|last1=Tartaglione|website=Deadline Hollywood}}</ref> in regular, [[RealD 3D]] and [[IMAX 3D]] formats.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://wegotthiscovered.com/movies/terminator-genisys-bring-judgement-day-imax-july/|title=Terminator: Genisys Will Bring Judgement Day To The IMAX In July}}</ref> On July 26 the film was playing in 64 countries outside North America,<ref name="Overseas5">{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2015/07/international-box-office-pixels-ant-man-minions-inside-out-monster-hunt-terminator-genisys-bhajrangi-bhaijaan-grosses-1201485296/|title=‘Minions’, ‘Ant-Man’ Grow In Actuals; ‘Pixels’ Powered By Latin America – Intl B.O. Final|first1=Nancy|last1=Tartaglione|work=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|publisher=([[Penske Media Corporation]])|date=July 27, 2015|accessdate=July 28, 2015}}</ref> and was released in China on August 23, 2015.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/terminator-genisys-gets-china-release-810285|title='Terminator: Genisys' Gets China Release Date as Blackout Nears End|author=Pamela McClintock|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|publisher=([[Prometheus Global Media]])|date=July 21, 2015|accessdate=July 22, 2015}}</ref>
===Marketing=== On December 2, 2014, Paramount released the film's first motion poster, showing a T-800 disintegrating into dust before the logo appeared. A preview trailer was released the following day, with brief clips from the film accompanied by "[[I'd Love to Change the World]]" by [[Jetta (musician)|Jetta]]. Differing from past ''Terminator'' releases, the preview had forced-looking camera motion in aerial-effect scenes and a first look at the [[color grading]] used to evoke the look of past films. The full trailer debuted on December 4.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.comingsoon.net/movies/news/388197-motion-poster-for-terminator-genisys-debuts-trailer-coming-thursday | title=Motion poster debuts, trailer coming Thursday|publisher=ComingSoon.net | first=Spencer| last=Perry|accessdate=December 2, 2014}}</ref> A second trailer (released In April 2015) was noted for [[Spoiler (media)|spoiling]] the scene in which John Connor becomes a Terminator,<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-3037649/Spoiler-alert-ahead-new-trailer-Terminator-Genisys-contains-crucial-plot-twist.html Spoiler alert ahead! Arnie the ageing cyborg makes an explosive return in new trailer for Terminator: Genisys... and a HUGE plot twist is revealed], Daily Mail</ref> a decision criticized by Alan Taylor and the writers.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/terminator-genisys-director-trailer-spoilers-806005|title='Terminator: Genisys' Director on Trailer Spoilers: "I Had a Few Unpleasant Conversations"|work=The Hollywood Reporter}}</ref>
[[WWE]]'s March 29, 2015 [[WrestleMania 31]] promoted the film with an elaborate entrance stage for [[Triple H]] in his match with [[Sting (wrestler)|Sting]]. On the stage, Triple H donning a Terminator outfit and a video played of Schwarzenegger saying: "Judgment Day is here. It's time to play the game."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://metro.co.uk/2015/03/30/wrestler-triple-hs-terminator-entrance-is-just-that-bit-better-with-added-arnold-schwarzenegger-5127009/ |title=Wrestler Triple H’s ‘Terminator’ entrance is just that bit better with added Arnold Schwarzenegger |author=Westbrook, Caroline |work=[[Metro (British newspaper)|Metro]] |date=March 30, 2015 |accessdate=April 1, 2015}}</ref> Several brands were promotional partners.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://brandchannel.com/2015/06/26/terminator-product-placement-062615/|title=Terminator Genisys Continues Hollywood Product Placement Trend|first=Abe|last=Sauer|date=June 26, 2015|work=brandchannel.com|accessdate=January 21, 2017}}</ref>
On June 14, Schwarzenegger visited [[Marine Corps Base Camp Pendleton]] for an advance screening of ''Terminator Genisys''.<ref>[http://timesofsandiego.com/military/2015/06/14/marines-chant-arnold-arnold-at-genisys-premiere/ Marines Chant ‘Arnold, Arnold’ at ‘Genisys’ Premiere], Times of San Diege, Chris Stone</ref> Two days later, [[Waze]] added Schwarzenegger's Terminator voice as a voice-navigation option.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/2015/06/14/arnold-schwarzenegger-waze-terminator-voice-app-terminator-genisys/71124570/|title=Exclusive: Arnold Schwarzenegger voices Waze as the Terminator|author=Bryan Alexander, USA TODAY|date=June 14, 2015|work=USA TODAY}}</ref> On June 19, he and Emilia Clarke appeared on ''[[The Graham Norton Show]]'' to promote the film.<ref>[http://www.mkweb.co.uk/GRAHAM-NORTON-Arnold-Schwarzenegger-Emilia-Clarke/story-26724596-detail/story.html THE GRAHAM NORTON SHOW: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Emilia Clarke, Jake Gyllenhaal Cara Delevingne], MKWeb, June 19</ref> Schwarzenegger released a video that day of himself walking around Hollywood dressed as the Terminator and posing as a wax model at [[Madame Tussauds Hollywood]]. The video promoted a fundraising contest to benefit the [[After-School All-Stars]] which would bring selected donors to the ''Terminator Genisys'' premiere.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.inquisitr.com/2193914/terminator-genisys-arnold-schwarzenegger-pranks-the-public-for-charity-video/|title=‘Terminator Genisys': Arnold Schwarzenegger Pranks The Public For Charity [Video]|date=June 22, 2015|accessdate=June 27, 2015|work=Inquisitr|publisher=Inquisitr, Ltd}}</ref>
Several [[List of YouTubers|YouTubers]] appeared with Schwarzenegger in a [[YouTube]] miniseries, ''Terminator Genisys: The YouTube Chronicles'', produced by Heresy and released on June 22.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://time.com/3933356/terminator-genisys-youtube-stars-360-virtual-reality/ | title=See What It’s Like to Hunt Down YouTube Stars as Terminator With This Virtual Reality 360 Video|publisher=Time.com |accessdate=June 28, 2015|first=Helen|last=Regan|date=June 24, 2015}}</ref> Consisting of videos uploaded by [[Machinima Inc.|Machinima]], [[Toby Turner]] and [[Lilly Singh]], the series also included [[Olga Kay]], [[Sean Klitzner]], [[Lloyd Ahlquist]], and [[Matthew Santoro]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLZLTS4u9M_2rIL6wRYh9RxVAR5hd7SF_4 | title=Terminator Genisys: The YouTube Chronicles|publisher=YouTube |date=June 22, 2015 |accessdate=June 28, 2015}}</ref> On June 24 Schwarzenegger spoke to attendees of an early fan screening of the movie in [[New York City]] (announced on [[Reddit]]), which was followed by an interview and selfie session.<ref>{{cite news|first=Kirsten|last=Acuna|url=http://uk.businessinsider.com/arnold-schwarzenegger-terminator-genisys-fan-screening-2015-6?r=US|title=Arnold Schwarzenegger showed up to a fan screening for the next 'Terminator' movie and took a selfie with everyone in the theater|date=June 25, 2015|accessdate=June 28, 2015|work=[[Business Insider]]}}</ref>
===Home media=== The film was released for [[Digital copy|digital download]] on October 20, 2015, and was released by Paramount Home Entertainment on DVD, Blu-ray and Blu-ray 3D on November 10. ''Terminator Genisys'' debuted as the bestselling [[Blu-ray]] and the most-rented film of the week, and was second in overall home-video sales to ''[[Inside Out (2015 film)|Inside Out]]''.<ref>{{cite web|title='Inside Out' Remains Atop Disc Sales, Edged by 'Terminator' on Blu-ray Chart|date=November 18, 2015|author=Arnold, Thomas K.|url=http://www.homemediamagazine.com/research/inside-out-remains-atop-disc-sales-edged-terminator-blu-ray-chart-37066|work =Home Media Magazine|accessdate=December 1, 2015}}</ref> It has grossed over $25.1 million in total domestic video sales, bringing the film's gross to $465.3 million.<ref>{{cite web|title=Terminator: Genisys (2015)|url=http://www.the-numbers.com/movie/Terminator-Genisys#tab=summary|website=The Numbers|accessdate=July 28, 2016}}</ref> A 4K UHD Blu-ray release occurred on June 12, 2018.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://ultrahd.highdefdigest.com/58156/terminatorgenisys4kultrahdbluray.html|title=High Def Digest {{!}} Blu-ray and Games News and Reviews in High Definition|website=ultrahd.highdefdigest.com|language=en|access-date=2018-05-07}}</ref>
==Reception==
===Box office=== ''Terminator Genisys'' grossed $89.7 million in North America and $350.8 million in other territories, for a worldwide total of $440.6 million.<ref name=BOM /> Of the ''Terminator'' franchise, only ''[[Terminator 2: Judgment Day]]'' earned more at the box office.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://moviepilot.com/posts/2015/09/21/rise-of-the-machines-why-terminator-6-should-happen-3553885?lt_source=external,manual|title=Rise of the Machines: Why Terminator 6 Should Happen|last=Patterson|first=Michael|date=September 20, 2015|publisher=Moviepilot|accessdate=October 12, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/scottmendelson/2015/09/06/box-office-mission-impossible-tops-500m-global-terminator-genisys-tops-terminator-3/|title=Box Office: 'Mission: Impossible' Crosses $500M Worldwide, 'Terminator Genisys' Tops 'Terminator 3'|last=Mendelson|first=Scott|date=September 6, 2015|work=Forbes|accessdate=October 12, 2015}}</ref> Because of its $155 million production budget and an estimated $50–100 million spent on marketing, ''[[Bloomberg Business]]'' reported that the film would have needed to earn at least $400 million in its theatrical run to break even.<ref>{{cite news |first=Anousha |last=Sakoui|title=‘Terminator’ Salvation Hinges on Global Fans After Harsh Reviews |date=July 1, 2015 |work=[[Bloomberg News]] |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2015-07-01/-terminator-salvation-hinges-on-global-fans-after-harsh-reviews |accessdate=July 19, 2015}}</ref> In August 2015 ''[[Forbes]]'' cited ''Terminator Genisys'' as the first American film to earn $400 million worldwide without grossing $100 million in North America, earnings comparable to the French film ''[[The Intouchables]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/scottmendelson/2015/08/30/box-office-terminator-genisys-crosses-400-million-worldwide/|title=Box Office: 'Terminator Genisys' Crosses $400 Million Worldwide|author=Scott Mendelson|work=Forbes|date=August 30, 2015|accessdate=August 31, 2015}}</ref> It was the first Hollywood release to earn $100 million in China and less than that in North America; both were duplicated the following summer by ''[[Warcraft (film)|Warcraft]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/scottmendelson/2016/06/08/warcraft-china-box-office-a-jaw-dropping-46-million-opening-day/#491093605711|title=Box Office: 'Warcraft' Snags Jaw-Dropping $46 Million Opening Day In China|author=Scott Mendelson|work=[[Forbes]]|date=June 8, 2016|accessdate=June 8, 2016}}</ref>
====North America==== The film opened on July 1, 2015 in the United States and Canada (the same day as the comedy-drama ''[[Magic Mike XXL]]'') in 3,700 theaters, and previewed the previous evening in 2,527 theaters. The two films and the holdovers ''[[Jurassic World]]'' and ''[[Inside Out (2015 film)|Inside Out]]'' were each projected to earn $45–55 million during the [[Independence Day (United States)|Independence Day]] holiday period and $27–30 million over the three-day weekend.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2015/06/terminator-genisys-magic-mike-xxl-box-office-july-4th-1201462173/|title=‘Terminator Genisys’ & ‘Magic Mike XXL’ Enter July 4th Frame Too Close To Call|author=Anthony D'Alessandro|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|date=June 29, 2015|accessdate=June 30, 2015}}</ref>
Box-office analysts noted that ''Terminator Genisys'' would have to compete with ''Jurassic World'' and, to some extent, ''[[Ted 2]]'' for male moviegoers. They expected the film to have the upper hand, replacing ''Jurassic World'' in [[IMAX]] theaters, but good earnings were needed overseas to make up any deficits.<ref name="A2">{{cite news|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/box-office-preview-can-magic-805699|title=Box Office Preview: Can the T-800 and Male Strippers Outrun 'Jurassic World'?|first=Pamela|last=McClintock|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=June 29, 2015|accessdate=June 30, 2015}}</ref> It made $2.3 million from the Tuesday-night preview—a record for Paramount Pictures, surpassing the $2.1 million earned by ''[[Hercules (2014 film)|Hercules]]'' (2014)—and $8.9 million on its Wednesday opening day.<ref name="T5">{{cite news|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/box-office-magic-mike-xxl-806211|title=Box Office: 'Magic Mike XXL' Narrowly Outstrips 'Terminator: Genisys' Tuesday Night|first=Pamela|last=McClintock|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=July 1, 2015|accessdate=July 2, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2015/07/magic-mike-xxl-starts-dancing-at-tuesday-night-previews-inside-out-crosses-200m-1201465698/|title=‘Magic Mike XXL’ Beats ‘Terminator Genisys’ At Tuesday Night Previews, ‘Inside Out’ Crosses $200M|author=Anthony D'Alessandro|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|date=July 1, 2015|accessdate=July 2, 2015}}</ref><ref name="OP">{{cite news|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/box-office-magic-mike-2-806211|title=Box Office: 'Magic Mike 2' Beats 'Terminator 5' But Both Need Bigger Fireworks|first=Pamela|last=McClintock|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=July 1, 2015|accessdate=July 2, 2015}}</ref> The film earned $42.4 million over the five-day opening stretch, including $27 million from 3,758 theaters over the weekend, placing it third at the box office behind ''Jurassic World'' and ''Inside Out''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2015/07/terminator-genisys-magic-mike-xxl-inside-out-july-4th-box-office-1201467675/|title=‘Inside Out’ Steals No. 1 From Dinos At July 4th B.O., ‘Magic Mike XXL’ Pops Viagra On Sunday – Actuals Update|author=Anthony D'Alessandro|work=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|accessdate=July 7, 2015}}</ref> Scott Mendelson of ''[[Forbes]]'' suggested several possible explanations for its box-office performance: poor marketing, negative reviews, competition from the family-friendly ''Jurassic World'' and ''Inside Out'', the decline of Schwarzenegger's star power and American indifference to another ''Terminator'' film.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/scottmendelson/2015/07/06/box-office-6-reasons-terminator-genisys-bombed-in-america/|title=Box Office: 6 Reasons 'Terminator Genisys' Bombed (In America)|author=Scott Mendelson|work=Forbes|publisher=Forbes, Inc.|date=July 6, 2015|accessdate=July 7, 2015}}</ref>
====Outside North America==== During the weekend of August 2, 2015, ''Terminator Genisys'' was playing in 65 countries (including the U.S. and Canada); the film was released in China on August 23.<ref name="OverseasOpening">{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2015/08/international-box-office-results-mission-impossible-rogue-nation-minions-ant-man-pixels-monster-hunt-bajrangi-bhaijaan-1201489609/|title=‘Rogue Nation’ Puts Cruise In Control At $64.5M Offshore; Sets Career & ‘M:I’ Franchise Bests – Intl Box Office Final|first1=Nancy|last1=Tartaglione|work=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|publisher=([[Penske Media Corporation]])|date=August 3, 2015|accessdate=August 4, 2015}}</ref> Comparisons of overseas box-office performance were made with Paramount's ''[[Mission: Impossible – Ghost Protocol]]'' (2011), ''[[Pacific Rim (film)|Pacific Rim]]'', ''[[Lucy (2014 film)|Lucy]]'' and ''[[World War Z (film)|World War Z]]'' rather than the preceding ''[[Terminator Salvation]]'' (2009) and the other ''Terminator'' films.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2015/07/terminator-genisys-pulls-in-27-9m-and-is-running-ahead-of-ghost-protocol-international-box-office-1201467761/|title=‘Terminator: Genisys’ Pulls In $27.9M And Is Running Ahead Of ‘Ghost Protocol’ – International Box Office|first=Anita|last=Busch|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|date=July 3, 2015|accessdate=July 4, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2015/jul/06/box-office-magic-mike-xxl-terminator-genisys|title=I'll be slack: Terminator Genisys flops as Magic Mike's pulling power proves XXS|author=Phil Hoad|work=[[The Guardian]]|publisher=([[Guardian Media Group]])|date=July 6, 2015|accessdate=July 7, 2015}}</ref><ref name="Intl">{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2015/07/international-box-office-terminator-genisys-minions-inside-out-baahubali-results-1201474737/|title=‘Minions’ Henchmen Nab $124M & No. 1 In 4th Frame; ‘Terminator’ Generates $47M – Intl Box Office|first1=Nancy|last1=Tartaglione|work=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|publisher=([[Penske Media Corporation]])|date=July 12, 2015|accessdate=July 13, 2015}}</ref> The film was released in ten countries before its North American debut beginning on June 25, earning $8.4 million over its opening weekend.<ref name="3rdweek"/> During its second weekend it expanded to 46 countries, earning $73.3 million and topping the international box office<ref name="4thweek">{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2015/07/international-box-office-terminator-genisys-minions-inside-out-jurassic-world-magic-mike-xxl-1201470806/|title=‘Terminator’ Back With $73.3M; 'Minions' Mints Higher Haul Of $56.2M – Intl Box Office Final |work=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|publisher=([[Penske Media Corporation]])|date=July 6, 2015|accessdate=July 7, 2015}}</ref> before being passed by ''[[Minions (film)|Minions]]'' the following weekend.<ref name="Intl"/> The film led in box-office receipts outside North America for four non-consecutive weekends.<ref name="5thOverseasOpening"/><ref name="6thOverseasOpening">{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2015/09/terminator-genisys-hitman-agent-47-straight-outta-compton-transporter-international-box-office-results-1201516578/|title=‘Terminator’, ‘Hitman’ Lead Sluggish Frame; ‘Compton’ Tops 5 Markets – International Box Office|first1=Nancy|last1=Tartaglione|work=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|publisher=([[Penske Media Corporation]])|date=September 6, 2015|accessdate=September 7, 2015}}</ref>
''Terminator Genisys'' had the franchise's biggest opening and Schwarzenegger's best in Singapore ($1.4 million) and Colombia ($1.3 million); both exceeded the opening of ''Terminator Salvation'' and that of 28 other countries, including Russia, Korea, and Mexico.<ref name="4thweek"/> The film topped the box office in Peru, Vietnam, Turkey, and 28 other countries,<ref name="3rdweek">{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2015/06/international-box-office-terminator-genisys-ted-2-jurassic-world-minions-inside-out-1201460765/|title='Terminator: Genisys' Lords Over 'Salvation'; Dinos Mighty With $84.3M More; ‘Minions’ Well Outpacing ‘DM2′ – Intl Box Office Final|first=Nancy|last=Tartaglione|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|date=June 29, 2015|accessdate=June 30, 2015}}</ref><ref name="4thweek"/> was Paramount's biggest Argentine opening ($2.3 million),<ref name="Intl"/> and was the biggest July opening and the fifth-biggest of all time in Russia and the CIS ($12.5 million).<ref name="4thweek"/> In the U.K. and Brazil it opened behind ''[[Minions (film)|Minions]]'', earning $5.8 million and $3.9 million, respectively, and was second in France to ''[[Les Profs 2]]'' with $3.8 million.<ref name="4thweek"/> Other notable openings were in South Korea ($11.2 million), Mexico ($6.1 million), Japan ($5.4 million), Australia ($4.4 million), Germany ($3.1 million), and India ($3 million).<ref name="Intl"/><ref name="4thweek"/> Its largest markets outside the U.S. and Canada were South Korea ($23.5 million), Russia ($21.8 million), Japan ($19 million) the U.K. ($16.1 million), and Brazil ($11.1 million).<ref name="Overseas5"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/hollywoods-2015-surprise-hits-misses-849770|title=Hollywood's Surprise 2015 Box-Office Hits and Misses Abroad|author=Scott Roxborough|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=December 23, 2015|accessdate=December 23, 2015}}</ref> ''Terminator Genisys'' earned $2.2 million from Chinese midnight showings (the fourth-largest of all time) and $27.4 million on its opening day, the fourth-biggest opening day of all time for a Hollywood film (behind ''[[Furious 7]]'', ''[[Avengers: Age of Ultron]]'' and ''[[Transformers: Age of Extinction]]''). It topped the international box office with a one-day gross from China.<ref name="Overseas4thweekend">{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2015/08/international-box-office-terminator-genisys-china-mission-impossible-rogue-nation-minions-inside-out-hitman-agent-47-uncle-results-1201503912/|title='Terminator' Back To No. 1 As China Re-Opens; 'M:I5' Adds $25M; 'Hitman' Contracts $8.5M – Intl B.O. Update|first1=Nancy|last1=Tartaglione|work=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|publisher=([[Penske Media Corporation]])|date=August 23, 2015|accessdate=August 14, 2015}}</ref> The film earned $82.8 million in its eight-day opening week (Sunday to Sunday), $58 million from Monday to Sunday and $23.4 million in its three-day opening weekend (Friday to Sunday).<ref name="5thOverseasOpening">{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2015/08/terminator-genisys-mission-impossible-rogue-nation-straight-outta-compton-hitman-international-box-office-results-1201510404/|title=‘Terminator’, ‘Mission: Impossible’ Each Cruise Past $300M; ‘Compton’ Tops In UK, Germany – Intl Box Office Update|first1=Nancy|last1=Tartaglione|work=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|publisher=([[Penske Media Corporation]])|date=August 30, 2015|accessdate=August 31, 2015}}</ref><ref name="China384">{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/china-box-office-terminator-genisys-819233|title=China Box Office: 'Terminator Genisys' Marches Towards $100M|author=Patrick Brzeski|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|publisher=([[Prometheus Global Media]])|date=August 31, 2015|accessdate=September 1, 2015}}</ref> Rob Cain of ''[[Forbes]]'' attributed the successful opening in China to Schwarzenegger's popularity, audience appetite for films with robots, disasters and machines and its being the first Hollywood film released after a 60-day blackout of non-Chinese films.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/robcain/2015/08/24/terminator-genisys-rocks-china-with-26-million-opening-day/|title='Terminator Genisys' Rocks China With $26 Million Opening Day|author=Rob Cain|work=Forbes|date=August 24, 2015|accessdate=August 30, 2015}}</ref> As of September 12, 2015, ''Terminator Genisys'' had grossed $112.8 million in China.<ref name="highest">{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2015/09/china-monster-hunt-all-time-china-record-beats-furious-7-1201522646/|title=‘Monster Hunt’ Overtakes ‘F7’ As All-Time China Box Office Champ In 2-Month Run|first1=Nancy|last1=Tartaglione|work=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|publisher=([[Penske Media Corporation]])|date=September 12, 2015|accessdate=September 12, 2015}}</ref><ref name="Overseas7thOpening">{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2015/09/mission-impossible-rogue-nation-maze-runner-scorch-trials-the-visit-fack-ju-gohte-legend-international-box-office-results-1201524744/|title=‘Maze Runner: Scorch Trials’ Ignites $26.8M Start; ‘Rogue Nation’ Tops With $91.3M, Crosses $600M WW – Intl B.O.|first1=Nancy|last1=Tartaglione|work=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|publisher=([[Penske Media Corporation]])|date=September 13, 2015|accessdate=September 14, 2015}}</ref>
===Critical response=== Review aggregator [[Rotten Tomatoes]] reports an approval rating of 26% based on 240 reviews, with an [[Rating average|average rating]] of 4.7/10. The website's critical consensus reads, "Mired in its muddled mythology, ''Terminator: Genisys'' is a lurching retread that lacks the thematic depth, conceptual intelligence, or visual thrills that launched this once-mighty franchise."<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/terminator_genisys/ | title=''Terminator Genisys'' (2015) | work=[[Rotten Tomatoes]] | publisher=[[Fandango Media]] | accessdate=March 2, 2018}}</ref> On [[Metacritic]], which assigns a [[weighted average]] to critic reviews, the film has a score of 38 out of 100, based on 41 critics, indicating "generally unfavorable reviews".<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.metacritic.com/movie/terminator-genisys | title=''Terminator Genisys'' Reviews |publisher=[[Metacritic]] |accessdate=July 2, 2015}}</ref> Audiences polled by [[CinemaScore]] gave the film an average grade of "B+" on an A+ to F scale.<ref name="Cinema">{{cite news|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/box-office-terminator-5-magic-806211|title=Box Office: 'Terminator 5,' 'Magic Mike 2' Off to Muted Start, Need Bigger Fireworks|first=Pamela|last=McClintock|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=July 1, 2015|accessdate=July 2, 2015}}</ref> The ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'' said critics found the film to be a "messy sequel" that was a "convoluted retread" of past films.<ref>{{cite news | last=Gettell | first=Oliver | url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/movies/moviesnow/la-et-mn-terminator-genisys-arnold-schwarzenegger-movie-reviews-critics-20150630-story.html | title='Terminator Genisys': Schwarzenegger can't save messy sequel, reviews say | work=[[Los Angeles Times]] | date=July 1, 2015 | accessdate=July 30, 2015 }}</ref> According to ''[[TheWrap]]'', critics found the time travel storyline to be "convoluted" and that the performances were "unremarkable" aside from Schwarzenegger reprising his role.<ref>{{cite news | last=Nakamura | first=Reid | url=http://www.thewrap.com/terminator-genisys-reviews-critics-nostalgic-bored-over-reboot/ | title='Terminator Genisys' Reviews: Critics Nostalgic, Bored Over Reboot | work=[[TheWrap]] | date=June 30, 2015 | accessdate=July 30, 2015 }}</ref>
Joe Morgenstern of ''[[The Wall Street Journal]]'' criticized the film, saying that it "plays like the worst of all outcomes".<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/terminator-genisys-review-nonsense-and-insensibility-1435775286 |title=‘Terminator Genisys’ Review: Nonsense and Insensibility |work=The Wall Street Journal |accessdate=July 3, 2015 |first=Joe |last=Morgenstern |date=July 1, 2015}}</ref> James Rocchi of TheWrap compared it negatively to ''[[The Terminator]]'', writing that ''Genisys'' "comes back from the past to water down a whole season of summer moviegoing".<ref>{{cite web|first=James|last=Rocchi |url=http://www.thewrap.com/terminator-genisys-review-arnold-schwarzenegger-emilia-clarke-jason-clarke-jai-courtney/ |title='Terminator Genisys' Review: Arnold Schwarzenegger's Swagger Can't Save This Redundant Tentpole |publisher=Thewrap.com |date=June 24, 2015 |accessdate=July 3, 2015}}</ref> Michael Phillips of the ''[[Chicago Tribune]]'' criticized the film's lack of originality, calling it "simply business and dull business at that".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/entertainment/movies/ct-terminator-genisys-review-20150630-column.html |title='Terminator Genisys' review: Rooting for the apocalypse |work=Chicago Tribune |accessdate=July 3, 2015 |date=June 30, 2015}}</ref>
Michael O'Sullivan of ''[[The Washington Post]]'' enjoyed the film: "''Genisys'' goes back to what made the franchise work in the first place: not the machine inside the man, but vice versa."<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/goingoutguide/movies/review-terminator-genisys-mixes-visceral-thrills-with-logic-holes/2015/06/30/b5dc6040-1f35-11e5-aeb9-a411a84c9d55_story.html|title=Review: ‘Terminator Genisys’ mixes visceral thrills with logic holes|author=Michael O'Sullivan|date=June 30, 2015|work=The Washington Post}}</ref> Richard Lawson of ''[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]]'' also gave a positive review, writing that the film "makes a surprisingly compelling case" for itself.<ref>{{cite web|last=Lawson |first=Richard |url=http://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2015/06/terminator-genisys-review |title=Terminator Genisys Review |work=Vanity Fair |date=January 2, 2014 |accessdate=July 3, 2015}}</ref> Mark Hughes of ''[[Forbes]]'' called many of the negative reviews a result of "cynical nostalgia" which "distrusts change and anticipates failure", calling the review-aggregator ratings "ridiculously and undeservedly low".<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/markhughes/2015/07/03/review-terminator-genisys-is-true-heir-to-camerons-films/ |title=Review: 'Terminator: Genisys' Is True Heir To Cameron's Films |work=Forbes |date=March 7, 2015 |accessdate=July 3, 2015 |first=Mark |last=Hughes}}</ref>
After seeing a pre-release screening of the film, Cameron voiced his support for ''Terminator Genisys''. Describing it as respectful to the first two films, Cameron said he felt like "the franchise has been reinvigorated".<ref>{{cite web|last1=Hutchinson|first1=Lee|title=Director James Cameron voices support for Terminator Genisys|url=https://arstechnica.com/the-multiverse/2015/06/director-james-cameron-voices-support-for-terminator-genisys/|website=Condé Nast|accessdate=June 9, 2015}}</ref> However, in 2017, James Cameron said that he had supported ''Terminator Genisys'' only because of his friendship with Schwarzenegger.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.screendaily.com/news/james-cameron-plans-to-produce-three-new-terminator-films/5120302.article|title=James Cameron plans to produce three new 'Terminator' films|last=Parfitt|first=Orlando|work=Screen Daily|date=July 26, 2017|accessdate=May 27, 2018}}</ref>
Emilia Clarke expressed relief to discover there wouldn't be any sequels following the film's poor box office performance. In reference to the film's director Alan Taylor, with whom she had worked on ''Game of Thrones'', Clarke said, "He was eaten and chewed up on ''Terminator''. He was not the director I remembered. He didn’t have a good time. No one had a good time."<ref>https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2018/05/emilia-clarke-cover-story </ref><ref>https://www.cinemablend.com/news/2424731/emilia-clarke-was-relieved-terminator-genisys-failed-at-the-box-office</ref>
==={{anchor|Accolades}}Nominations=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Award ! Category ! Recipient ! Result ! Ref(s) |- | rowspan="2"| Golden Schmoes Awards | Worst Movie of the Year ! | {{nom}} | rowspan="2"| <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.joblo.com/goldenschmoes/results/golden-schmoes-winners-and-nominees-2015|title=Golden Schmoes Winners And Nominees (2015)}}</ref> |- | Biggest Disappointment of the Year ! | {{nom}} |- | [[Jupiter Award (film award)|Jupiter Awards]] | Best International Actress | [[Emilia Clarke]] | {{nom}} | |- | [[42nd Saturn Awards|Saturn Awards]] | [[Saturn Award for Best Science Fiction Film|Best Science Fiction Film]] ! | {{nom}} | <ref name="Saturn 42">{{cite web|url=http://www.saturnawards.org/|title=The 42nd Annual Saturn Awards nominations are announced for 2016!|publisher=[[Saturn Award]]s|date=February 24, 2016|accessdate=March 4, 2016}}</ref> |- | rowspan="2"| [[2015 Teen Choice Awards|Teen Choice Awards]] | Choice Summer Movie ! | {{nom}} | rowspan="2"| <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.teenchoice.com/article/winners-of-%E2%80%9Cteen-choice-2015%E2%80%9D-announced|title=WINNERS OF TEEN CHOICE 2015 ANNOUNCED|work=[[Teen Choice Awards]]|publisher=[[Fox Broadcasting Company|FOX]]|date=August 16, 2015|accessdate=August 17, 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150818075858/http://www.teenchoice.com/article/winners-of-%E2%80%9Cteen-choice-2015%E2%80%9D-announced|archivedate=August 18, 2015|df=mdy-all}}</ref> |- | Choice Summer Movie Star: Female | Emilia Clarke | {{nom}} |- |Weibo Movie Awards Ceremony |Most Popular Song in China |Jane Zhang| Jane Zhang | {{nom}} |<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://ent.sina.com.cn/m/c/2016-05-24/doc-ifxsktkp9234219.shtml?uq8|title=微博电影之夜启动 亿万网友票选电影之最|website=ent.sina.com.cn|access-date=2018-10-16}}</ref> |}
==Canceled sequel and reboot== {{Main|Terminator 6}} In December 2013, ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'' reported that a television series was in the works, which would tie into a new ''Terminator'' trilogy.<ref>{{cite news|url= http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/new-terminator-tv-series-works-663447|title= New 'Terminator' TV series in the works|author= Lesley Goldberg|work= [[The Hollywood Reporter]]|publisher= [[Guggenheim Partners]]|date= December 6, 2013|accessdate= July 27, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url= http://screenrant.com/terminator-new-tv-series-movie-reboot-tie-in/|title= New ‘Terminator’ TV Series To Tie-In With Movie Reboot Trilogy|author= Ben Kendrick|publisher= Screen Rant|date= December 6, 2013|accessdate= July 27, 2015}}</ref> Development stalled in 2015 after ''Terminator Genisys'' under-performed in China.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2015/09/mission-impossible-rogue-nation-china-record-1201544867/|title=‘Mission: Impossible – Rogue Nation’ Becomes Highest Grossing 2D Film in China — Deadline|author=Anthony D'Alessandro, Nancy Tartaglione|website=Deadline Hollywood|accessdate=October 1, 2015}}</ref> On October 1, 2015, ''The Hollywood Reporter'' confirmed that the sequels and television spin-off were on hold indefinitely, following the film's overall box office performance.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/dangers-financiers-think-they-can-827843|title=The Dangers When Financiers Think They Can Produce Movies, Too|author=Kim Masters|work=The Hollywood Reporter|accessdate=October 1, 2015}}</ref> According to Skydance COO Dana Goldberg, the company was pressing forward with development but would further analyze market research before starting production.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thewrap.com/thegrill-2015-terminator-genisys-producer-on-franchises-future-not-on-hold-but-re-adjusting/|title=TheGrill 2015: 'Terminator: Genisys' Producer on Franchise's Future: Not on Hold but 'Re-Adjusting' (Video)|work=TheWrap|accessdate=October 7, 2015}}</ref>
In January 2016, the sequel was removed from Paramount's release schedule.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/paramount-takes-terminator-sequel-release-857746|title=Paramount Takes 'Terminator' Sequel Off Release Schedule|author=Pamela McClintock|date=January 20, 2016|work=The Hollywood Reporter|accessdate=January 20, 2016}}</ref> In April 2016, Emilia Clarke said that she would not return for any sequels.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.comingsoon.net/movies/news/678551-emilia-clarke-terminator-sequels#/slide/1 | title=Emilia Clarke Says No to More Terminator Sequels | publisher=Comingsoon.net | date=April 20, 2016 | accessdate=April 20, 2016 | last=Lesnick | first=Silas}}</ref> In April 2018, Jason Clarke was asked by Collider if he knew any details about the planned direction of the cancelled Genisys sequel, to which he said: {{cquote|What I remember was that second one was going to be about John’s journey after he was taken by Skynet…like going down to what he became; half machine, half man. That’s where the second one was going to start, and that’s about all I knew. It’s such a bummer we didn’t get to do that.}}
On January 20, 2017, ''[[Deadline Hollywood|Deadline]]'' reported that James Cameron, who regains the film rights of the franchise in 2019, will produce the next ''Terminator'' film intended to reboot the franchise once again to the events following ''[[Terminator 2: Judgment Day]]''.<ref name="Cameron-T6-Deadline" /> Skydance's David Ellison remained involved and declared his intention to have [[Tim Miller (director)|Tim Miller]] direct it.<ref name="Cameron-T6-Deadline">{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2017/01/terminator-james-cameron-deadpool-tim-miller-david-ellison-skydance-1201890848/|title=He’s Back! James Cameron To Godfather ‘Terminator’ With ‘Deadpool’ Helmer Tim Miller|first=Mike Fleming|last=Jr|date=January 21, 2017|website=Deadline Hollywood|accessdate=January 21, 2017}}</ref> In May 2017, Schwarzenegger confirmed he will appear in the next ''Terminator'' film, with Cameron overseeing production.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://whatculture.com/film/terminator-6-arnold-schwarzenegger-will-return?rf=homepage|title=Terminator 6: Arnold Schwarzenegger WILL Return|date=May 21, 2017|work=WhatCulture.com|access-date=November 14, 2017|language=en}}</ref> Cameron later stated that he is working with Ellison to set up a trilogy of films.<ref name="Caneron-T6-NewsComAu" /> The intention is for Schwarzenegger to be involved to some extent but also introduce new characters and "pass the baton".<ref name="Caneron-T6-NewsComAu">{{Cite news|url=http://www.news.com.au/entertainment/movies/titanic-and-avatar-director-james-cameron-hoping-to-make-new-terminator-trilogy/news-story/27e00d478eeaf4c8b31c681a29bde13c|title=I’ll be back: James Cameron wants more Terminator — with Arnie|work=NewsComAu|access-date=November 14, 2017}}</ref> The next film in the series is scheduled for release on November 22, 2019.<ref>{{cite web|title=Next 'Terminator' Movie Pushed Back Four Months to Fall 2019 |url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/next-terminator-movie-pushed-back-four-months-november-2019-1100659|date=April 8, 2018|website=The Hollywood Reporter|accessdate=April 8, 2018}}</ref>

revision.text:
{{primary sources|date=January 2018}} {{Infobox organization | name = Ukrainian Association for Jewish Studies | native_name = Українська асоціація юдаїки | image = | size = | alt = | caption = | map = | map_size = | map_alt = | map_caption = | map2 = | map2_size = | map2_alt = | map2_caption = | abbreviation = | motto = | predecessor = | merged = | successor = | formation = {{start date|2015}} | founder = | type = | tax_id = | registration_id = <!-- for non-profit org --> | status = Non-profit academic NGO | purpose = | headquarters = | location = [[Kyiv]], [[Ukraine]] | coords = | region = | services = | methods = | fields = | membership = | membership_year = | language = | sec_gen = | leader_title = President | leader_name = Vitaly Chernoivanenko | leader_title2 = Vice President | leader_name2 = Oleksiy Khamray | leader_title3 = Secretary | leader_name3 = Serhiy Hirik | leader_title4 = | leader_name4 = | board_of_directors = | key_people = | main_organ = | parent_organization = | subsidiaries = | secessions = | affiliations = | budget = | budget_year = | revenue = | revenue_year = | disbursements = | expenses = | expenses_year = | endowment = | staff = | staff_year = | volunteers = | volunteers_year = | slogan = | mission = | website = {{url|www.uajs.org.ua}} | remarks = | formerly = | footnotes = }} '''The Ukrainian Association for Jewish Studies''' (UAJS) is a non-profit academic and professional non-governmental organization that brings together Ukrainian scholars and students who work in the field of [[Jewish studies]]. The UAJS was established in 2015.
The mission of the UAJS is to coordinate efforts of the scholars resident in Ukraine and abroad, aimed at the development of research on history, languages, art and other aspects of Jewish life in Ukraine and worldwide. There are two membership categories, Full membership and Student membership. The UAJS’ Articles of Association allows membership for foreign academicians <ref>{{cite web|url=http://uajs.org.ua/en/node/3|title=Membership - Ukrainian Association for Jewish Studies|website=uajs.org.ua}}</ref>.
Current UAJS President is [[Vitaly Chernoivanenko]], PhD, Associate Professor in the History Department at the [[National University of Kyiv-Mohyla Academy]] (NaUKMA), the Vice President is [[Oleksiy Khamray]], Dr. hab. in Philology, Director of the Near and Middle East Department at the [[Ahatanhel Krymskyi Institute of Oriental Studies of the National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine]]. Secretary of the UAJS is [[Serhiy Hirik]], PhD in History, Senior Research Fellow at the [[State Research Institution "Encyclopedia Press"]].
Practical activity of the UAJS includes the organization of the academic conferences, roundtables, workshops, public talks, and mini courses on Jewish Studies<ref>{{cite web|url=http://uajs.org.ua/en/node/5|title=Projects - Ukrainian Association for Jewish Studies|website=uajs.org.ua}}</ref>.
The UAJS publishes an annual academic journal [[Judaica Ukrainica]], established in 2012<ref>{{cite web|url=http://judaicaukrainica.ukma.edu.ua/content/volumes|title=Volumes - Judaica Ukrainica|website=judaicaukrainica.ukma.edu.ua}}</ref>. The UAJS also is a publisher of “Library of ''Judaica Ukrainica'' journal”.
The Ukrainian Association for Jewish Studies co-administers the MA in Jewish Studies Program at the National University of Kyiv Mohyla Academy (founded in 2012)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://uajs.org.ua/en/node/8|title=Master in Jewish Studies Program at NaUKMA - Ukrainian Association for Jewish Studies|website=uajs.org.ua}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web|url=https://hromadskeradio.org/programs/zustrichi/shcho-take-yudayika-abo-yak-vidkryti-universytety-poyednuyut-istoriyu-movy-ta-religiyu|title=Що таке юдаїка, або Як «відкриті університети» поєднують історію, мови та релігію?|date=21 January 2018|website=Громадське радіо}}</ref>.
The organization cooperates with a number of academic and educational institutions and non-governmental organizations from Ukraine and abroad: [[National University of Kyiv-Mohyla Academy]], [[Ukrainian Catholic University]], Institute of Jewish Studies of the [[Jagiellonian University]], [[Hebrew University of Jerusalem]], [[Université de Montréal]], [[Jewish Theological Seminary of America]], [[United States Holocaust Memorial Museum]], [[Ukrainian Jewish Encounter]] Initiative, [[Nadav Foundation]], [[:uk:Асоціація єврейських громадських організацій та общин України|Vaad of Ukraine]], [[European Association for Jewish Studies]], [[:he:האיגוד העולמי למדעי היהדות|World Union of Jewish Studies]] etc.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://uajs.org.ua/en/node/6|title=Partners - Ukrainian Association for Jewish Studies|website=uajs.org.ua}}</ref> In cooperation with its partner institutions the UAJS acts as a co-organizer of academic events in educational and research institutions of Ukraine.
In 2015–2016 academic year, in partnership with the [[Institute for the Study of Global Antisemitism and Policy]] (Canada–USA), the UAJS organized at the NaUKMA the series of public lectures and discussions "Contemporary Antisemitism in Ukraine and Worldwide" by well known researchers, public figures and journalist from Ukraine and abroad: [[Yaroslav Hrytsak]], [[Yosyf Zisels]], [[Vakhtang Kipiani]], [[Taras Voznyak]], [[Vitaly Portnikov]] etc.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://isgap.org/seminar-series/national-university-ukraine/|title=National University of Kyiv Mohyla Academy » ISGAP|website=isgap.org}}</ref>
In October 2017, the Ukrainian Association for Jewish Studies and the NaUKMA’s Master Program in Jewish Studies with the support of the [[European Association for Jewish Studies]] organized the International conference “Ukrainian Jews: Revolution and Post-Revolutionary Modernization. Policy, Culture, and Society”, dedicated to the destiny of Ukrainian Jews during 1917–1920s. The event brought together the scholars from Ukraine, Austria, Germany, Hungary, Israel, the UK, the USA<ref>{{cite web|url=http://vaadua.org/news/uayu-i-naukma-proveli-mizhnarodnu-konferenciyu-ievreyi-ukrayini-revolyuciya-y|title=УАЮ і НаУКМА провели Міжнародну конференцію «Євреї України: Революція й післяреволюційна модернізація»|date=23 October 2017|publisher=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://uajs.org.ua/en/node/131|title=UAJS and NaUKMA organized the International conference “Ukrainian Jews: Revolution and Post-Revolutionary Modernization” - Ukrainian Association for Jewish Studies|website=uajs.org.ua}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://odessareview.com/vitaly-chernoivanenko-jewish-studies-ukraine/|title=Vitaly Chernoivanenko On Jewish Studies In Ukraine. An Interview by Vladislav Davidzon|date=|publisher=''The Odessa Review''. Issue 11 (October-November 2017), p. 31}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.jpost.com/Israel-News/Culture/A-DUBIOUS-ANNIVERSARY-507960|title="A Dubious Anniversary. Should the Jewish community celebrate a century since the Russian Revolution?" by Julie Masis|date=October 20, 2017|publisher=''The Jerusalem Post''}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.timesofisrael.com/100-years-on-international-conferences-debate-jewish-role-in-russian-revolution/|title="100 years on, international conferences debate Jewish role in Russian Revolution" by Julie Masis|date=October 28, 2017|publisher=''The Times of Israel''}}</ref>.
In October 2018 the UAJS has organized the international conference "Modern Israel: From State in Construction to State Facing Challenges" on occasion of the 70th anniversary of the State of Israel. The researchers from Canada, the USA, Germany, Israel, Poland, Sweden, the UK, and Ukraine participated in this event. The topics of the history of Israel and Zionism, relations between Israel and another countries, Israeli society and culture etc. were discussed during the conference. The event was supported by the Nadav Foundation, the European Association of Israel Studies and the Masoret Kiev community<ref>{{cite web|url=http://hadashot.kiev.ua/content/pervaya-v-ukraine-nauchnaya-konferenciya-ob-izraile-proshla-v-kieve/|title=Юрий Корогодский. "Первая в Украине научная конференция об Израиле прошла в Киеве"|date=November 2018|publisher=''Хадашот: Газета Ассоциации еврейских организаций и общин Украины''}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.istpravda.com.ua/columns/2018/11/16/153287//|title=Сергій Гірік. "Як організовувати конференції з єврейських студій? Погляд ізсередини"|date=November 16, 2018|publisher=''Історична правда''}}</ref>.

'''Unconditional convergence''' is a topological property (convergence) related to an algebraic object (sum). It is an extension of the notion of [[convergence (mathematics)|convergence]] for series of countably many elements to series of arbitrarily many. It has been mostly studied in [[Banach space]]s.
A series of numbers is unconditionally convergent if under all reorderings of the numbers, their sum converges to the same value as under the given ordering—their sum is not conditional on the particular arrangement. In contrast, a series is [[conditional convergence|conditionally convergent]] if it converges but different orderings do not all converge to that same value.
== Definition == Let <math>X</math> be a [[topological vector space]]. Let <math>I</math> be an [[index set]] and <math>x_i \in X</math> for all <math>i \in I</math>.
The series <math>\textstyle \sum_{i \in I} x_i</math> is called '''unconditionally convergent''' to <math>x \in X</math>, if * the indexing set <math>I_0 :=\{i\in I: x_i\ne 0\}</math> is [[countable]] and * for every [[permutation]] of <math>I_0 :=\{i\in I: x_i\ne 0\}</math> the relation holds:<math>\sum_{i=1}^\infty x_i = x</math>
==Alternative definition== Unconditional convergence is often defined in an equivalent way: A series is unconditionally convergent if for every sequence <math>(\varepsilon_n)_{n=1}^\infty</math>, with <math>\varepsilon_n\in\{-1, +1\}</math>, the series
:<math>\sum_{n=1}^\infty \varepsilon_n x_n</math>
converges.
If ''X'' is a Banach space, every [[absolute convergence|absolutely convergent]] series is unconditionally convergent, but the [[converse (logic)|converse]] implication does not hold in general. Indeed, if ''X'' is an infinite dimensional Banach space, then by [[absolute convergence#Rearrangements and unconditional convergence|Dvoretzky–Rogers theorem]] there always exists an unconditionally convergent series in this space that is not absolutely convergent. However, when ''X'' = '''R'''<sup>''n''</sup>, then, by the [[Riemann series theorem]], the series <math>\sum x_n</math> is unconditionally convergent if and only if it is absolutely convergent.
==See also== *[[Modes of convergence (annotated index)]] *[[Riemann series theorem]] *[[absolute convergence#Rearrangements and unconditional convergence|Dvoretzky–Rogers theorem]] *[[Absolute convergence#Rearrangements and unconditional convergence|Rearrangements and unconditional convergence]]
==References== * Ch. Heil: [http://www.math.gatech.edu/~heil/papers/bases.pdf A Basis Theory Primer] * {{cite book | last = Knopp | first = Konrad | title = Infinite Sequences and Series | isbn = 9780486601533 | publisher = Dover Publications | year = 1956 | language = }} * {{cite book | last = Knopp | first = Konrad | title = Theory and Application of Infinite Series | publisher = Dover Publications | year = 1990 | isbn = 9780486661650 | language = }} *{{cite book | last=Wojtaszczyk | first=P. | title=Banach spaces for analysts | year=1996 | publisher=Cambridge University Press | isbn=9780521566759}}
{{PlanetMath attribution|urlname=unconditionalconvergence|title=Unconditional convergence}}

revision.text:
{{notability|date = December 2008}}
A '''Zero Waste Event''' (or "ZeeWee" as it has been nicknamed) is one in which event organizers plan ahead to reduce solid waste from the event, reuse various elements such as banners, and set up Zero-Waste Stations for those recyclable and compostable materials such as [[paper cup]]s, food scraps, and plastic [[water bottle]]s that are generated by the event. ZeeWees can range from large scale sports events to weddings and parties.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sconnect.org/bizdev/conference/ |title=Future of Business Conference- Sustainable Strategies for 2013 — Sustainable Connections |publisher=Sconnect.org |date=2013-04-26 |accessdate=2015-05-15}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sconnect.org/bizdev/tzw/TZW08_insert_v4.pdf/ |format=PDF |title=Think Local - Buy Local : Be waste Free |publisher=Sconnect.org|accessdate=2015-05-15}}</ref><ref>[http://sustainabletransforum.ca/presentations.html] {{dead link|date=May 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=|url=http://theredbarncooperative.wordpress.com/2008/06/15/jill-donello-zero-in-on-zero-waste/ |title=Jill Donello – Zero In on Zero Waste | |publisher=Theredbarncooperative.wordpress.com |date= |accessdate=2015-05-15}}</ref>
==Background== As sustainability becomes ever more accepted as a concept within organizations and communities across the nation, the idea of [[Zero waste|Zero Waste]] Events is spreading. Additionally, the steady expansion of recycling and commercial composting infrastructure makes it possible to offer recycling and food composting at events in many locations. Increasingly [https://web.archive.org/web/20120322144442/http://zerowasteevents.org/protocol/ Zero Waste Events] are sharing best practices and developing new ways to divert event materials from landfills.
==Strategy== ZeeWee's utilize many if not all of the following strategies.
'''Front-end waste prevention''' * Eliminating race packets in favor of emailed sponsor coupons for participants; * Eliminating commercial [[bottled water]] distribution in favor of bulk water stations and compostable cups; * Purchasing recycled content products, from event [[t-shirt]]s to paper products; and * Providing discounted entries or incentives for participants who travel to the event using alternative transportation. <ref>[http://www.skitosea.com/content/green_team/green_team.asp ] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081009153628/http://www.skitosea.com/content/green_team/green_team.asp |date=October 9, 2008 }}</ref>
'''Reuse of event equipment''' * Reusable, weatherproof banners and stands; * Adaptable date panels on banners and signs so they can be reused year after year; and * Use of durable dishware "lending libraries"<ref>[http://www.re-sources.org/wastereduction.htm ] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080925211512/http://www.re-sources.org/wastereduction.htm |date=September 25, 2008 }}</ref> instead of always buying disposables.
'''Recycling event materials''' * Many items from unsoiled paper, cardboard, glass, [[plastic bottle]]s and jugs, aluminum cans and plastic tarps to corrugated polypropylene signs can be recycled depending on the services available in a given municipality or county. In many cases, such services are less costly than disposal of the same items; * Having a dedicated Recycling Team onsite throughout the event to supervise recycling stations and sort materials to maximize landfill diversion and minimize contamination;<ref>{{cite web|author=Alison Dunn |url=http://runningmagazine.ca/sections/news/vancouver-half-recycles-95-of-waste/ |title=Vancouver half-marathon produces only four bags of garbage - Canadian Running Magazine |publisher=Runningmagazine.ca |date=2013-06-26 |accessdate=2015-05-15 |deadurl=yes }}</ref> and * Where programs require subsidy, ZeeWee organizers may use a "green fee" to help move the event toward sustainability by paying for [[Waste minimisation|waste reduction]], buying recycled products, or more recently purchasing carbon offsets.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.norkarecreation.com/hcrewards.htm |title=Bellingham/Whatcom County Washington |publisher=NorKarecreation.com |date=2013-09-08 |accessdate=2015-05-15}}</ref>
==2012 Olympics== When the bid was submitted for the [[2012 Summer Olympics|London 2012 Olympic]] and [[2012 Summer Paralympics|Paralympic Games]], [[LOCOG]], The London 2012 Organising Committee of the Olympic and Paralympic Games, pledged not just to host the biggest sporting event in the world but also to stage the first truly sustainable Games.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-13160540 |title=London 2012 Olympics team publishes first green report - BBC News |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2015-05-15}}</ref> Central to this was an ambitious target to send zero waste from Games-time venues directly to landfill <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.london2012.com/documents/locog-publications/london-2012-sustainability-plan.pdf |title=Official Reports, Studies, Publications | Downloads | Olympic.org |publisher=London2012.com |date= |accessdate=2015-05-15}}</ref> – something that no Games has attempted before. In February 2012 an initiative was launched to share the lessons learnt from delivering a zero waste games with the wider waste and events community.<ref>[http://zerowasteevents.org/front/] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130327035411/http://zerowasteevents.org/front/ |date=March 27, 2013 }}</ref>
